Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. Mann Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 03/08/18 Court ordered case reopened and judgment vacated.  Charge amended to OWI 4th. Court resentenced defendant with all penalties completed.  Probation completed.

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs paid in full

supervisions.notes:
08/22/18 COURT ORDERED CASE REOPEND AND JUDGMENT VACATED. 
Time Served.

Court finds defendant is not obligated to pay supervision fees.
Court finds fines, costs, revocation, ignition interlock and assessment have been satisfied.

Defendant Thomas M. Mann in court with attorney Scott L Schroeder.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds good cause to re-open case and vacate conviction. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation, already served, $600 fine plus costs, already paid, 90 days RCJ, already served, credited toward conditional time that was already served, AODA, already completed, DL revoked for 27 months, retroactive, already completed, IID 27 months, retroactive and already complied with.
